site.notes: Former psychiatric hospital in Weston, WV (originally Weston State Hospital), built 1858-1881 on the Kirkbride plan; now operates as a heritage/paranormal tourism site with history tours, ghost tours, and overnight ghost hunts. Strong example of a former institutional/psychiatric site marketed through haunting narratives.

aliases: West Virginia Hospital for the Insane

tv_episodes.synopsis: In a TAPS team first, the team travels to West Virginia to investigate the Weston State Hospital, once one of the largest psychiatric hospitals in the country.

The one-hour series premiere tells the tales of Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum, which is reportedly haunted by a little girl named Lilly who is still looking for her mommy after her death. The first half of the episode explores an old abandoned train tunnel called the "Flinderation Tunnel", also in Weston, West Virginia.
The Ghost Adventures crew gets locked inside the Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum for their first-ever live paranormal investigation.

Two teams from West Virginia go head to head: Appalachee Paranormal (Tony, Jeff, and Matt) and G.A.L.S. Paranormal (Ghosts, Apparitions, and Lost Souls) (Jackie, Mandy, and Stacey) investigate the Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum, a former psychiatric hospital that is believed to be one of the country's most haunted sites.

tv_episodes.episode_title: Yorktown Hospital and Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum
tv_episodes.synopsis: In the second half of this episode, Zak reviewed some evidence from GA's only live event, from 2009, of the Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum. Also, there was a few moments from the show, Paranormal Challenge, that was shown to Rebecca Gleason. Unlike the Yorktown Hospital situation, the asylum's reputation grew in popularity, after both the GA's and Paranormal Challenge episodes were aired. Overall, it has become an attraction for ghost-hunting enthusiasts every weekend. Some time, after the two episodes were aired, a spirit named "Big Jim" has supposedly came into prominence in the asylum. Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum interviewees: Rebecca Gleason (owner), "Copperhead" (employee), and Paul Cipar (employee).
Grant comes back and joins the crew.

For 72 hours, Nick and Katrina confine themselves in the Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum in Weston, West Virginia, including Ward F, the Women's Auxiliary Building and the Medical Building's morgue. For Katrina, it's her first time inside Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum, the enormous, abandoned and haunted facility in West Virginia. For Nick, it is a return to the place where he had one of his most profound paranormal experiences.

Jack and Katrina venture inside the imposing stone walls of a notoriously haunted hospital in Weston, West Virginia, that housed thousands of mentally ill patients over a dark 130-year-old history. Their investigation uncovers mind-blowing truths.

The team heads to West Virginia to explore the most haunted asylum in America. Dakota has doubts about their ability to combat the bloodthirsty souls lurking in the shadows of the cursed property, but Tanner believes they are up for the challenge.

Kesha and rapper Big Freedia face their worst fears at Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum. The building comes to life overnight, spurring violent activity and revealing disturbing truths. Psychic Chip Coffey joins them in hopes of setting the spirits free.

Josh, Phil and Heather investigate what may be the most haunted building in America: the Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum, where thousands died after disturbing medical procedures. It's said their angry ghosts roam its now-abandoned halls.

Johnny and Jordyn travel to Weston, West Virginia to explore the Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum, one of the most haunted locations in America. The setting once housed the worst experiments from lobotomies to solitary confinement and housed everyone from mistaken mental patients to cold blooded killers. The guys have the place to themselves for three nights and decide to make the most of it.

Jordyn and Johnny continue their paranormal investigation of the Trans-Allegheny Asylum in Weston, West Virginia. As their time there continues, the stories of hauntings are validated leaving the guys more convinced than ever before in the presence of paranormal.
